article_title: French Rail Reviews Cost-Saving Options, SNCF’s Pepy Says in JDD
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LS2TDH0D9L3501","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-09-25/french-rail-reviews-cost-saving-options-sncf-s-pepy-says-in-jdd"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-6iDf5IF"}   Societe Nationale des Chemins de Fer Francais, France’s state-owned rail company, must find ways to make its TGV high-speed rail service more efficient and may regroup travelers on railways used by both high-speed and local lines, Journal du Dimanche said today, citing an interview with SNCF Chief Executive Officer Guillaume Pepy.    SNCF needs “to invest in a new generation” train to keep the TGV program competitive internationally with Japanese, Korean and German rivals, Pepy said, according to the newspaper.     Published on ‎25‎ ‎September‎, ‎2011‎ ‎13‎:‎38        Have a confidential tip for our reporters? GET IN TOUCH    Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
